Comments_List: An overview of Egyptian religious texts from the Old Kingdom to the Roman Period; we identified overarching themes and the evolution of the Pyramid Texts into the Coffin Texts into the Book of the Dead, as well as new developments whose origins we critically examined.

Architecture of different tombs and how they relate to the afterlife concept of Ancient Egypt 
Different Underworld Books and their locations in the tombs
Presentation of  a concept for practice for conferences
Research regarding artifacts
Research of concepts of the Afterlife

I loved this course! I enjoyed its structure and how it was made clear from the very beginning. Sometimes it was hard to keep up notetaking with the pace of the course, but only because I was really fascinated and wanted to get every single word down. I like how we got an excellent overview of texts throughout Ancient Egyptian history, while still involving enough detail that we could really engage with the texts and compare them, both with each other and with architecture and material culture. The assignments (such as the mini-essay for grad students) were especially effective for this.
It's great and introduces all concepts of the Afterlife, along with the chronology and development of the afterlife
Yes! Wonderful to understand ancientEgyptian afterlife and development of concepts
